intro: Epacris rivularis, commonly known as the river epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and rocky areas. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are adapted for pollination by nectar-feeding birds and insects. Epacris rivularis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
